channel.title: Tink
channel.description: Flash Platform development and personal rants.

item.title: FlexBitmap?
item.dc:creator: Tink
item.description: Whats the correct way to display a BitmapData object in Flex 2.0? I would have thought from the naming that FlexBitmap would hold your BitmapData, but FlexBitmap isn't a UIComponent so it can only be displayed as in rawChildren. 1. What is the best way to display a BitmapData in Flex (i.e. the Flex 2 version of [...]
item.content:encoded:
Whats the correct way to display a BitmapData object in Flex 2.0?

I would have thought from the naming that FlexBitmap would hold your BitmapData, but FlexBitmap isn't a UIComponent so it can only be displayed as in rawChildren.

1. What is the best way to display a BitmapData in Flex (i.e. the Flex 2 version of Bitmap)?

2. What is a FlexBitmap for if it aint an abstract class, it can't be used in Flex, and it can't be used in Flash?

Any help appreciated.

UPDATE
Todd posted this pretty simple solution

PLAIN TEXT
Actionscript:
  1. var myBitmap:Bitmap = new Bitmap(yourBitmapData)
  2. var myImage:Image = new Image()
  3. myImage.addChild(myBitmap)
  4. someContainer.addChild(myImage)

or if you looking for an object you can use in Flex with the same API as Bitmap, u can use this RealFlexBitmap class (u might want to fill in some of the gaps!)


PLAIN TEXT
Actionscript:
  1. package tink.display
  2. {
  3.         import flash.geom.Rectangle;
  4.         import mx.core.FlexBitmap;
  5.         import flash.display.DisplayObjectContainer;
  6.         import mx.core.IUIComponent;
  7.         import flash.events.Event;
  8.         import mx.managers.ISystemManager;
  9.         import flash.display.Sprite;
  10.         import flash.display.DisplayObject;
  11.  
  12.         public class RealFlexBitmap extends FlexBitmap implements IUIComponent
  13.         {
  14.                 public function get owner():DisplayObjectContainer
  15.                 {
  16.                         return null;
  17.                 }

  20.                 {

  66.                 }

  69.                 {

item.title: T-Mobile Web n Walk
item.dc:creator: Tink
item.description: I've been with Orange for te last few years and they have provided a great service, but when it comes to Internet access via your phone they are so expensive (75 for unlimited Internet). I'm really thinking of moving over to T-Mobile who have some great unlimited internet packages at the moment from around 25 a [...]
item.content:encoded:
I've been with Orange for te last few years and they have provided a great service, but when it comes to Internet access via your phone they are so expensive (75 for unlimited Internet).

I'm really thinking of moving over to T-Mobile who have some great unlimited internet packages at the moment from around 25 a moth including calls etc. You can even get a T-Mobile card for your laptop for 19.99.

Anyone have anything bad to say about T-Mobile before I take the plunge?

item.title: London Flash Platform User Group August 2006
item.dc:creator: Tink
item.description: Big thanks to AKQA for hosting last months event. This month we're back at the Play Bar. This time we have Andrew Shorten from Adobe showing use some Apollo stuff (without breaking any NDA's ) and we have a team from Glue London to talk us through some of there recent flash/video work. We have the [...]
item.content:encoded:
Big thanks to AKQA for hosting last months event. This month we're back at the Play Bar.

This time we have Andrew Shorten from Adobe showing use some Apollo stuff (without breaking any NDA's ) and we have a team from Glue London to talk us through some of there recent flash/video work.

We have the venue until 2am so we can celebrate 10 year of Flash in style without wandering the streets.

Also last month videos and presentations are now online Development Techniques for Localizing Flash (27/07/2006), Introduction to Flash 9 (27/07/2006) (eeerrrr unfortunately eeeerrr the camera errr buggered eeer up on the eeerrr second session, so errrr there is only eeerrr 15 mins of eeerrr video).

London Flash Platform User Group 24th August 2006 (24/08/2006). See ya there!!

item.title: Flash Tenth Anniversary
item.dc:creator: Tink
item.description: We asked ten experienced Flash designers from all around the world... Nice to see they got someone representing the UK, Spain, Germany, France etc or even Europe (NOT). Flash: Ten years, ten perspectives EDIT Ah yeah we have some in the developer center. Obviously we're just shit designers Flash: Ten years, ten perspectives
item.content:encoded:
We asked ten experienced Flash designers from all around the world...

Nice to see they got someone representing the UK, Spain, Germany, France etc or even Europe (NOT).

Flash: Ten years, ten perspectives

EDIT
Ah yeah we have some in the developer center. Obviously we're just shit designers

Flash: Ten years, ten perspectives

item.title: 10 Years of Flash
item.dc:creator: Tink
item.description: Happy Birthday Flash!!! Today Flash is officially 10 years old and to celebrate, yesterday FWA, in conjunction with Adobe, announced a community poll to establish what the most influential Flash site has been in the last 10 years. 10 Years of Flash. Make sure ya get your votes in.
item.content:encoded:
Happy Birthday Flash!!!

Today Flash is officially 10 years old and to celebrate, yesterday FWA, in conjunction with Adobe, announced a community poll to establish what the most influential Flash site has been in the last 10 years.

10 Years of Flash. Make sure ya get your votes in.

item.title: AS 3.0 Cloning/Concatenating Graphics (with Proxy)
item.dc:creator: Tink
item.description: With Rich's prompt I've been alking a look at proxy and how it could remove some of the code in this class. To get it to work the class needs to be dynamic, which means not compile time errors, but you still get run time errors. I'm not sure if i like this approach to be [...]
item.content:encoded:
With Rich's prompt I've been alking a look at proxy and how it could remove some of the code in this class. To get it to work the class needs to be dynamic, which means not compile time errors, but you still get run time errors.

I'm not sure if i like this approach to be honest, but it does cut down on the code, by removing the need to duplicate all the Graphics drawing methods.


PLAIN TEXT
Actionscript:
  1. package tink.graphics
  2. {
  3.        
  4.         import flash.display.Graphics;
  5.         import flash.display.BitmapData;
  6.         import flash.geom.Matrix;
  7.         import flash.utils.Proxy;
  8.         import flash.utils.flash_proxy;
  9.  
  10.  
  11.         dynamic public class CloneableGraphics extends Proxy
  12.         {
  13.                
  14.                 private var _graphics:Graphics;
  15.                 private var _clone:Array;
  16.                
  17.                 /**
  18.                  * Constructor.
  19.                  */
  20.                 public function CloneableGraphics( graphics:Graphics = null ):void
  21.                 {
  22.                         if( graphics ) _graphics = graphics;
  23.                        
  24.                         initialize();
  25.                 }
  26.                
  27.                 /**
  28.                  * Initializes the class by creating an Array to store all the drawing methods that take place.
  29.                  */
  30.                 private function initialize():void
  31.                 {
  32.                         _clone = new Array();
  33.                 }
  34.                
  35.                 /**
  36.                  * Creates a CloneableGraphicsVO instance.
  37.                  * This object stores the method name as a String and the arguments as an Array.
  38.                  *
  39.                  * Each instance is then push into a Array.
  40.                  */
  41.                 private function createStep( method:String, arguments:Array ):void
  42.                 {
  43.                         var vo:CloneableGraphicsVO = new CloneableGraphicsVO();
  44.                         vo.method = method;
  45.                         vo.arguements = arguments;
  46.                        
  47.                         _clone.push( vo );
  48.                 }
  49.                
  50.                 /**
  51.                  * This is where the re-drawing takes place.
  52.                  * The method String is evaluated and then invoked in the switch statement, passing the correct parameters.
  53.                  */
  54.                 private function invokeStep( step:Object ):void
  55.                 {
  56.                         var vo:CloneableGraphicsVO = CloneableGraphicsVO( step );
  57.                         var method:Function = _graphics[ vo.method ];
  58.                        
  59.                         method.apply( this, vo.arguements );
  60.                 }
  61.                
  62.  
  63.                 /**
  64.                  * Concat
  65.                  *
  66.                  * Joins the Array of CloneableGraphicsVO instances with another Array of CloneableGraphicsVO instances
  67.                  * that were created in another CloneableGraphics instance.
  68.                  */
  69.                 public function concat( concat:Array ):void
  70.                 {
  71.                         _clone = _clone.concat( concat );
  72.                        
  73.                         var iterations:int = concat.length;
  74.                        
  75.                         for( var i:int = 0; i <iterations; i++ )
  76.                         {
  77.                                 invokeStep( concat[ i ] );
  78.                         }
  79.                 }
  80.                
  81.                
  82.                
  83.                 /**
  84.                  * Setter for graphics object
  85.                  *
  86.                  * Sets the Graphics instances to invoke the drawing methods on.
  87.                  */
  88.                 public function set graphics( graphics:Graphics ):void
  89.                 {
  90.                         _graphics = graphics;
  91.                 }
  92.                
  93.                
  94.                
  95.                 /**
  96.                  * Getter/Setters for cloning
  97.                  *
  98.                  * Get
  99.                  * Returns an Array of CloneableGraphicsVO instances created in tthe instance of this class.
  100.                  *
  101.                  * Set
  102.                  * Clears the current Graphics instance and Array storing CloneableGraphicsVO instances by invoking 'clear()'.
  103.                  * Then invokes 'concat()' passing the Array of CloneableGraphicsVO instance passed to the setter.
  104.                  */
  105.                 public function get clone():Array
  106.                 {
  107.                         return _clone;
  108.                 }
  109.                 public function set clone( clone:Array ):void
  110.                 {
  111.                         clear();
  112.                        
  113.                         concat( clone );
  114.                 }
  115.                
  116.                
  117.                
  118.                 public function clear():void
  119.                 {
  120.                         _graphics.clear();
  121.                        
  122.                         _clone = new Array();
  123.                 }
  124.                
  125.                
  126.                
  127.                 /**
  128.                  * Catch all methods that are not defined in the class and invoke them on the referenced Graphics instance,
  129.                  * then invokes 'createStep' passing the method name, and the arguments passed.
  130.                  */
  131.                 flash_proxy override function callProperty( methodName:*, ...arguments ):*
  132.                 {
  133.                         var method:Function  = _graphics[ methodName ];
  134.                         method.apply( _graphics, arguments );
  135.                        
  136.                         createStep( methodName, arguments );
  137.                 }
  138.                
  139.         }
  140.        
  141. }

item.title: AS 3.0 Cloning/Concatenating Graphics
item.dc:creator: Tink
item.description: After reading this post, this morning, whilst everyone was out in the sun, I decided I would set myself a little task this to enable users to clone and concatenate graphics drawn within a Graphics instance in AS 3.0. You can still draw directly in any Graphics instance, but any drawing done directly on a graphics [...]
item.content:encoded:
After reading this post, this morning, whilst everyone was out in the sun, I decided I would set myself a little task this to enable users to clone and concatenate graphics drawn within a Graphics instance in AS 3.0.

You can still draw directly in any Graphics instance, but any drawing done directly on a graphics instance will not be cloned. If you draw directly in a Graphics instance, you can still use CloneableGraphics.concat() on the CloneableGraphics instance and it will concatenate the graphics drawn directly in the Graphics instance with any returned from the CloneableGraphics instance.

CloneableGraphics is the main class that enables the functionality. You have to create an instance of this class in your Sprite, MovieClip etc. and pass it the instance of the Graphics class that is created by default. You then need to invoked all the drawing methods on the instance of this class instead of the graphics instance.

PLAIN TEXT
Actionscript:
  1. package tink.graphics
  2. {
  3.        
  4.         import flash.display.Graphics;
  5.         import flash.display.BitmapData;
  6.         import flash.geom.Matrix;
  7.  
  8.  
  9.         public class CloneableGraphics
  10.         {
  11.                
  12.                 private var _graphics:Graphics;
  13.                 private var _clone:Array;
  14.                
  15.                 /**
  16.                  * Constructor.
  17.                  */
  18.                 public function CloneableGraphics( graphics:Graphics = null ):void
  19.                 {
  20.                         if( graphics ) _graphics = graphics;
  21.                        
  22.                         initialize();
  23.                 }
  24.                
  25.                 /**
  26.                  * Initializes the class by creating an Array to store all the drawing methods that take place.
  27.                  */
  28.                 private function initialize():void
  29.                 {
  30.                         _clone = new Array();
  31.                 }
  32.                
  33.                 /**
  34.                  * Creates a CloneableGraphicsVO instance.
  35.                  * This object stores the method name as a String and the arguments as an Array.
  36.                  *
  37.                  * Each instance is then push into a Array.
  38.                  */
  39.                 private function createStep( method:String, arguments:Array ):void
  40.                 {
  41.                         var vo:CloneableGraphicsVO = new CloneableGraphicsVO();
  42.                         vo.method = method;
  43.                         vo.arguements = arguments;
  44.                        
  45.                         _clone.push( vo );
  46.                 }
  47.                
  48.                 /**
  49.                  * This is where the re-drawing takes place.
  50.                  * The method String is evaluated and then invoked in the switch statement, passing the correct parameters.
  51.                  */
  52.                 private function invokeStep( step:Object ):void
  53.                 {
  54.                         var vo:CloneableGraphicsVO = CloneableGraphicsVO( step );
  55.                         var method:Function = _graphics[ vo.method ];
  56.                        
  57.                         method.apply( this, vo.arguements );
  58.                 }
  59.                
  60.  
  61.                 /**
  62.                  * Concat
  63.                  *
  64.                  * Joins the Array of CloneableGraphicsVO instances with another Array of CloneableGraphicsVO instances
  65.                  * that were created in another CloneableGraphics instance.
  66.                  */
  67.                 public function concat( concat:Array ):void
  68.                 {
  69.                         _clone = _clone.concat( concat );
  70.                        
  71.                         var iterations:int = concat.length;
  72.                        
  73.                         for( var i:int = 0; i <iterations; i++ )
  74.                         {
  75.                                 invokeStep( concat[ i ] );
  76.                         }
  77.                 }
  78.                
  79.                
  80.                
  81.                 /**
  82.                  * Setter for graphics object
  83.                  *
  84.                  * Sets the Graphics instances to invoke the drawing methods on.
  85.                  */
  86.                 public function set graphics( graphics:Graphics ):void
  87.                 {
  88.                         _graphics = graphics;
  89.                 }
  90.                
  91.                
  92.                
  93.                 /**
  94.                  * Getter/Setters for cloning
  95.                  *
  96.                  * Get
  97.                  * Returns an Array of CloneableGraphicsVO instances created in tthe instance of this class.
  98.                  *
  99.                  * Set
  100.                  * Clears the current Graphics instance and Array storing CloneableGraphicsVO instances by invoking 'clear()'.
  101.                  * Then invokes 'concat()' passing the Array of CloneableGraphicsVO instance passed to the setter.
  102.                  */
  103.                 public function get clone():Array
  104.                 {
  105.                         return _clone;
  106.                 }
  107.                 public function set clone( clone:Array ):void
  108.                 {
  109.                         clear();
  110.                        
  111.                         concat( clone );
  112.                 }
  113.                
  114.                
  115.                
  116.                 /**
  117.                  * Graphics methods.
  118.                  *
  119.                  * Duplication of all public drawing methods of the Graphics class.
  120.                  *
  121.                  * Each invokes the drawing method on the referenced Graphics instance,
  122.                  * then invokes 'createStep' passing the method (callee) name, and the arguments passed.
  123.                  */
  124.                 public function beginBitmapFill( bitmap:BitmapData, matrix:Matrix = null, repeat:Boolean = true, smooth:Boolean = false ):void
  125.                 {
  126.                         _graphics.beginBitmapFill( bitmap, matrix, repeat, smooth );
  127.                        
  128.                         createStep( "beginBitmapFill", arguments );
  129.                 }
  130.                
  131.                 public function beginFill( color:uint, alpha:Number = 1.0 ):void
  132.                 {
  133.                         _graphics.beginFill( color, alpha );
  134.                        
  135.                         createStep( "beginFill", arguments );
  136.                 }
  137.                
  138.                 public function beginGradientFill( type:String, colors:Array, alphas:Array, ratios:Array, matrix:Matrix = null, spreadMethod:String = "pad", interpolationMethod:String = "rgb", focalPointRatio:Number = 0 ):void
  139.                 {
  140.                         _graphics.beginGradientFill(type, colors, alphas, ratios, matrix, spreadMethod, interpolationMethod, focalPointRatio );
  141.                        
  142.                         createStep( "beginGradientFill", arguments );
  143.                 }
  144.                
  145.                 public function clear():void
  146.                 {
  147.                         _graphics.clear();
  148.                        
  149.                         _clone = new Array();
  150.                 }
  151.                
  152.                 public function curveTo( controlX:Number, controlY:Number, anchorX:Number, anchorY:Number ):void
  153.                 {
  154.                         _graphics.curveTo( controlX, controlY, anchorX, anchorY );
  155.                        
  156.                         createStep( "curveTo", arguments );
  157.                 }
  158.                
  159.                 public function drawCircle( x:Number, y:Number, radius:Number ):void
  160.                 {
  161.                         _graphics.drawCircle( x, y, radius );
  162.                
  163.                         createStep( "drawCircle", arguments );
  164.                 }
  165.                
  166.                 public function drawEllipse( x:Number, y:Number, width:Number, height:Number ):void
  167.                 {
  168.                         _graphics.drawEllipse( x, y, width, height );
  169.  
  170.                         createStep( "drawEllipse", arguments );
  171.                 }
  172.                
  173.                 public function drawRect( x:Number, y:Number, width:Number, height:Number ):void
  174.                 {
  175.                         _graphics.drawRect( x, y, width, height );
  176.                        
  177.                         createStep( "drawRect", arguments );
  178.                 }
  179.                
  180.                 public function drawRoundRect( x:Number, y:Number, width:Number, height:Number, ellipseWidth:Number, ellipseHeight:Number ):void
  181.                 {
  182.                         _graphics.drawRoundRect( x, y, width, height, ellipseWidth, ellipseHeight );
  183.                        
  184.                         createStep( "drawRoundRect", arguments );
  185.                 }
  186.                
  187.                 public function endFill():void
  188.                 {
  189.                         _graphics.endFill();
  190.                        
  191.                         createStep( "endFill", arguments );
  192.                 }
  193.                
  194.                 public function lineGradientStyle( type:String, colors:Array, alphas:Array, ratios:Array, matrix:Matrix = null, spreadMethod:String = "pad", interpolationMethod:String = "rgb", focalPointRatio:Number = 0 ):void
  195.                 {
  196.                         _graphics.lineGradientStyle( type , colors, alphas, ratios, matrix, spreadMethod, interpolationMethod, focalPointRatio );
  197.                        
  198.                         createStep( "lineGradientStyle", arguments );
  199.                 }
  200.                
  201.                 public function lineStyle( thickness:Number, color:uint = 0, alpha:Number = 1.0, pixelHinting:Boolean = false, scaleMode:String = "normal", caps:String = null, joints:String = null, miterLimit:Number = 3 ):void
  202.                 {
  203.                         _graphics.lineStyle( thickness, color, alpha, pixelHinting, scaleMode, caps, joints, miterLimit );
  204.                        
  205.                         createStep( "lineStyle", arguments );
  206.                 }
  207.                
  208.                 public function lineTo(x:Number, y:Number):void
  209.                 {
  210.                         _graphics.lineTo( x, y );
  211.                        
  212.                         createStep( "lineTo", arguments );
  213.                 }
  214.                
  215.                 public function moveTo(x:Number, y:Number):void
  216.                 {
  217.                         _graphics.moveTo( x, y );
  218.                        
  219.                         createStep( "moveTo", arguments );
  220.                 }
  221.                
  222.         }
  223.        
  224. }

CloneableGraphicsVO is a helper class. It is just used inside the CloneableGraphics class to keep things strict and tidy.

PLAIN TEXT
Actionscript:
  1. package tink.graphics
  2. {
  3.         public class CloneableGraphicsVO
  4.         {
  5.                
  6.                 public var method:String;
  7.                 public var arguements:Array;
  8.                
  9.                 public function CloneableGraphicsVO():void
  10.                 {
  11.                         initialize();
  12.                 }
  13.                
  14.                 private function initialize():void
  15.                 {
  16.                         arguements = new Array();
  17.                 }
  18.                
  19.         }
  20. }

Heres an example of how you would use CloneableGraphics inside a Sprite.

PLAIN TEXT
Actionscript:
  1. package
  2. {
  3.         import flash.display.Sprite;
  4.        
  5.         import tink.graphics.CloneableGraphics;
  6.  
  7.         public class CloneGraphicsExample extends Sprite
  8.         {
  9.                
  10.                 public var cloneableGraphics:CloneableGraphics;
  11.                
  12.                 public function CloneGraphicsExample()
  13.                 {
  14.                         super();
  15.                        
  16.                         initialize();
  17.                 }
  18.                
  19.                 private function initialize():void
  20.                 {
  21.                         cloneableGraphics = new CloneableGraphics( graphics );
  22.                 }
  23.         }
  24. }

And heres the AS project that i tested the functionality in. The first instance created is the instance who's graphics instance is draw in and used to clone/concatenate.

The second instance shows you the clone taking place by creating a new CloneGraphicsExample and using the CloneableGraphics.clone() method to draw inside it.

The third instance shows you the cancatenating taking place. A new CloneGraphicsExample is created and draw inside. The CloneGraphicsExample.concat() method is then used to concatenate the graphics drawn and graphics from the first instance together.

PLAIN TEXT
Actionscript:
  1. package
  2. {
  3.  
  4.         import flash.display.Sprite;
  5.        
  6.         public class CloneGraphicsExampleProject extends Sprite
  7.         {
  8.                
  9.                 private var cloned      : CloneGraphicsExample;
  10.                 private var clone       : CloneGraphicsExample;
  11.                 private var concat      : CloneGraphicsExample;
  12.                
  13.                 public function CloneGraphicsExampleProject()
  14.                 {
  15.                         super();
  16.                                
  17.                         initialize();
  18.                 }
  19.                        
  20.                 private function initialize():void
  21.                 {
  22.                         cloned = new CloneGraphicsExample();
  23.                         cloned.y = 0;
  24.                         cloned.cloneableGraphics.beginFill( 0xFF0000, 1 );
  25.                         cloned.cloneableGraphics.drawCircle( 25, 25, 25 );
  26.                         cloned.cloneableGraphics.endFill();
  27.                         addChild( cloned );
  28.                        
  29.                        
  30.                         clone = new CloneGraphicsExample();
  31.                         clone.y = 75;
  32.                         clone.cloneableGraphics.clone = cloned.cloneableGraphics.clone;
  33.                         addChild( clone );
  34.                        
  35.                         concat = new CloneGraphicsExample();
  36.                         concat.y = 150;
  37.                         concat.cloneableGraphics.beginFill( 0x0000FF, 1 );
  38.                         concat.cloneableGraphics.drawCircle( 50, 25, 25 );
  39.                         concat.cloneableGraphics.endFill();
  40.                         concat.cloneableGraphics.concat( cloned.cloneableGraphics.clone );
  41.                         addChild( concat );
  42.                 }
  43.  
  44.         }
  45. }

Download example AS 3.0 project.

item.title: Custom Events in AS 3.0 (dont forget to override the clone method)
item.dc:creator: Tink
item.content:encoded:
In AS 3.0 you can now create your own Events that extends the Event class.

PLAIN TEXT
Actionscript:
  1. package.events
  2. {
  3.  
  4.      public class CustomEvent extends Event
  5.      {
  6.  
  7.           public static const CUSTOM_TYPE:String = "customType";
  8.  
  9.           public var customProp:String;
  10.  
  11.           public function CustomEvent( type:String, cp:String, bubbles:Boolean, cancelable:Boolean )
  12.           {
  13.                super( type, bubbles, cancelable )
  14.  
  15.                customProp = cp;
  16.           }
  17.  
  18.      }
  19.  
  20. }

This can then be used like so

PLAIN TEXT
Actionscript:
  1. dispatchEvent( new CustomEvent( CustomEvent.CUSTOM_TYPE, "myProp", true ) );

This works fine until you need to re-dispatch the event, in the case that you event doesn't bubble as its dispatched from an object that isn't in a displayList. If you do re-dispatch the event like so...


PLAIN TEXT
Actionscript:
  1. myDispatcher.addEventListener( CustomEvent.CUSTOM_TYPE, onCustomEvent );
  2.  
  3. private function onCustomEvent( event:CustomEvent ):void
  4. {
  5.      dispatchEvent( event );
  6. }

the event is cast back to the type Event. To solve this you need to override te clone method inside your custom event class. This will keep you event as its original type.

PLAIN TEXT
Actionscript:
  1. package.events
  2. {
  3.  
  4.      public class CustomEvent extends Event
  5.      {
  6.  
  7.           public static const CUSTOM_TYPE:String = "customType";
  8.  
  9.           public var customProp:String;
  10.  
  11.           public function CustomEvent( type:String, cp:String, bubbles:Boolean, cancelable:Boolean )
  12.           {
  13.                super( type, bubbles, cancelable )
  14.  
  15.                customProp = cp;
  16.           }
  17.  
  18.           public override function clone():Event
  19.           {
  20.                return new CustomEvent( type, customProp, bubbles, cancelable );
  21.           }
  22.  
  23.      }
  24.  
  25. }

item.title: Flash Article in Creative Review
item.dc:creator: Tink
item.description: Theres a nice little article about how Flash 8 is shaping up (the good and the bad) in July's issue of Creative Review titled 'Flash Grows Up', accompanied by a brief history of Flash. It features the likes of Joshua Davis, Joshua Hirsch (Big Spaceship), Jon McVey (Zaaz) and Florian Schmitt (Hi-ReS!). Worth a browse if your [...]
item.content:encoded:
Theres a nice little article about how Flash 8 is shaping up (the good and the bad) in July's issue of Creative Review titled 'Flash Grows Up', accompanied by a brief history of Flash.

It features the likes of Joshua Davis, Joshua Hirsch (Big Spaceship), Jon McVey (Zaaz) and Florian Schmitt (Hi-ReS!).

Worth a browse if your near a magazine store hanging around.

item.title: Webcast of tonights LFPUG
item.dc:creator: Tink
item.description: With tonights user group full (did i forget to mention the free booze and pizza courtesy of our hosts AKQA), we (I say we but i mean Stefan) are going to try and broadcast tonights presentations using FMS. Its our first effort at this so there no guarentees on the quality or if we will [...]
item.content:encoded:
With tonights user group full (did i forget to mention the free booze and pizza courtesy of our hosts AKQA), we (I say we but i mean Stefan) are going to try and broadcast tonights presentations using FMS. Its our first effort at this so there no guarentees on the quality or if we will actually be able to get it up and running.

The webcast will start at 19:00 GMT and can be viewed at http://www.lfpug.com/live. There are a limited amount of connections so again its first come first served. You can view the overview for tonights meeting at http://www.lfpug.com/27nd-july-2006-27072006/.

Big thanks to MoreMX.com for providing the FMS hosting, and to Stefan for taking this on and sorting it all out!
